questions.question_text:
A user contacts a technician to troubleshoot server errors. The user explains that some files will not open on the server, the data backups are operational, and the weather has been bad. The technician notices missing time slots in the event log.
Which of the following should the technician replace to prevent these issues in the future?

discussion.content: The weather was bad and there are missing time slots which means the server probably died a few times due to inconsistent or unavailable power. A surge protector will only protect from surges which a battery backup can also do.

Selected Answer: D
D. Battery Backup represents Uninterruptible Power Supply in situations such as power outages and blackouts, brownouts.
my first thought was B also till I read the question again. It clearly is going for loss of power and not power surges. So Battery Backup should be the answer.
but if you don`t have surge protector and get spikes in power, your system shuts down to protect itself and restarts .

comments.content: No, surge protectors keep the machines from being fried as a result of power surge. Most cases of a power surge/spike, the buildings power panel will throw breakers to avoid the surge from causing fire by overheating the wires and outlets as well as protecting any machines plugged into those sockets. However, that safety feature is not without faults. That is where the surge protectors come in. With that said, if the breakers were to flip to cut the circuit, you then have no power which will result in the missing time in the event logs. A power recycle of a machine turning off and back on will still log the occurrence in the event logs. So to prevent gaps in the event log due to the server not being on, you would need the battery backup.

discussion.content: Why not B? I can not see any relation with battery backup and a server.

comments.content:
"the weather has been bad. The technician notices missing time slots in the event log."
In context of this question, bad weather could have caused blackouts that can only be prevented with a battery backup aka UPS. That's why there were missing logs as server was not on.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Plaintext Authentication
Most commonly used protocols/applications transmit reusable passwords in clear(plaintext passwords).
These protocols include...
TELNET - remote login

@Suraj97 - Secure Socket Shell, is a protocol that allows you to connect securely to a remote computer or a server by using a text-based interface.

Secure Shell (SSH) for Linux-based machines
Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) for Windows-based machines
It should be B. SSH right?

questions.question_text: A technician connected to a network switch remotely from a workstation. During an audit, a security analyst discovered the technician transmitted the username and password in plaintext over the network. Which of the following remote access technologies did the technician use to connect?

choices.C: Ensure the PC meets the minimum requirements.
choices.A: Uninstall, reinstall, and restart the application.

comments.content: The easiest, fastest, and least intrusive FIRST... then A

discussion.content: CompTIA is all about doing the fastest thing first, surely checking requirements takes seconds, I think C is the answer here

comments.content:
If the PC does not meet minimum requirements, then "A" would have been a waste of time.
Therefore I go with "C" FIRST.

discussion.content: The key here is to resolve the issue. If they asked what should be done "next", maybe checking would make sense but because they said to resolve then I would go with A.

One of the best tips i've received from the discussion is,
If they ask what do you do FIRST,always pick check the (insert rest of question)
This has been the case for all those questions
Replace ensure with, CHECK the PC meets the minimum requirements

Selected Answer: C
C. Ensure the PC meets the minimum requirements.

I believe it is C.
1. Checking the requirements will determine if it is the app that is causing the issues or if it is the PC.
2. This is much faster than performing answer A. 

Once you can confirm it is the application, then you can continue with A. But if it's the computer doesn't meet the requirements, you would be dealing with the PC before you did anything with the application.

Selected Answer: C
"checking requirements takes seconds"
A. is the answer
User is working on desktop not PC .A answer is correct
First things first remember identify the cause the action would go with c
Im going C ohttps://www.examtopics.com/exams/comptia/220-1002/view/#n this one

questions.question_text: A user's desktop will not run an accounting program. The program's splash screen pops up, and then the software freezes. Which of the following actions should a technician take FIRST to help resolve the issue?

discussion.content: For anyone curious: Authentication and Authorization are separate in TACACS+. It also supports two methods to control the authorization of router commands on a per-user or per-group basis.

questions.question_text: Which of the following allows for per-command authentication and authorization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
B doesn't sound good
D not really likely. Most of 32bit software can be installed on 64bit OS 
A and C are good options, but it says USER which drives me more to C
It would be nice to know what the error message says
ACD are all possible answers, right?

comments.content: They are all possible, and I thought A was the correct answer until I re-read the question and saw it mentioned that this is a "work" computer. With that in mind, I would agree that C is the MOST likely cause of the issue.

questions.question_text: A user receives an error message when trying to upgrade an application on a work computer. Which of the following is the MOST likely reason the user cannot complete this task?

choices.D: A 32-bit application cannot be installed on a 64-bit system.
choices.A: The computer does not meet the application's minimum requirements.
choices.C: The user account lacks administrative rights.
choices.B: The program is being deployed via optical media.
